meanings.definition: A type of salad green with broad, slightly bitter leaves.
meanings.sent1: I added some escaroles to my salad for extra flavor.
meanings.sent2: The grocery store had fresh escaroles on sale this week.
meanings.sent3: The escaroles in the salad were so bitter, they made my face scrunch up!
meanings.sent4: Her garden was a sea of escaroles, waving gently in the breeze.
meanings.sent5: The escaroles looked like miniature green umbrellas, ready to shield the other veggies.

meanings.definition: Plural form of escarole, referring to multiple instances of the vegetable.
meanings.sent1: I bought a bunch of escaroles to make a big salad for the party.
meanings.sent2: The escaroles at the market were fresh and vibrant.
meanings.sent3: The fridge was overflowing with escaroles, threatening to take over the whole kitchen!
meanings.sent4: The field was a patchwork of escaroles, creating a beautiful mosaic of green.
meanings.sent5: The escaroles piled high in the basket, ready to be transformed into a delicious meal.
